meanings.definition: A key point or lesson learned from a situation.
meanings.sent1: The takeaway from the story is to always be kind to others.
meanings.sent2: One important takeaway from the meeting was the need for better communication.
meanings.sent3: The takeaway from the movie was that honesty is the best policy.
meanings.sent4: Her takeaway from the experience was the importance of perseverance.
meanings.sent5: The main takeaway from the class was the value of hard work.

meanings.definition: Food that is prepared in a restaurant but intended to be eaten elsewhere.
meanings.sent1: I ordered some Chinese takeaway for dinner.
meanings.sent2: She picked up some Indian takeaway on her way home.
meanings.sent3: The takeaway smelled so good that I couldn't resist eating it on the way.
meanings.sent4: The Thai takeaway was a delicious treat after a long day.
meanings.sent5: The pizza takeaway was still warm when it arrived at my door.

meanings.definition: The act of taking something away from a place.
meanings.sent1: His takeaway of the stolen goods led to his arrest.
meanings.sent2: The takeaway of the old furniture made the room look more spacious.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon's takeaway of the picnic basket left the campers surprised.
meanings.sent4: The magician's takeaway of the coin amazed the audience.
meanings.sent5: The student's takeaway of the book without permission was not allowed.
